statements.name: PROC DATEKEYS
statements.description: Creates and manages datekeys that are associated with time computations.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Obtains separate calendar variables for groups of observations that are defined by the BY variables.

statements.name: DATEKEYCALENDAR
statements.description: Writes variables that indicate the active time periods for datekeys. The active periods are indicated with a value of 1, and the inactive periods are indicated with a value of 0.

statements.name: DATEKEYDATA
statements.description: Inputs datekeys from a datekeys data set or writes datekeys to a datekeys data set. You can specify multiple DATEKEYDATA statements.

statements.name: DATEKEYDEF
statements.description: Defines a datekey that can be interpreted in other SAS procedures. You can specify multiple DATEKEYDEF statements.

statements.name: DATEKEYDSOPT
statements.description: Limits the input and output processing of data sets to a specified locale.

statements.name: DATEKEYKEY
statements.description: Alters a user-defined or predefined SAS datekey, or creates a new datekey from another datekey. You can specify multiple DATEKEYKEY statements.

statements.name: DATEKEYPERIODS
statements.description: Writes variables that list the active time periods in the input time ID for datekeys. The active period dates, datetime values, or observation numbers, are listed with the associated datekey.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: Specifies a numeric variable that identifies observations in the input and output data sets.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: Copies input variables to the output calendar variables data set. If the VAR statement is omitted, all numeric variables are selected except those that appear in a BY or ID statement.
